product.text:
The Emperor's New Groove

Kuzco is a self-centered teenage emperor who plans on building his summer home on the hill-top village where Pacha and his family live. When the evil Yzma accidently turns the emperor into a llama (she was trying to poison him), Kuzco needs all the friends he can get. With Pacha's help, the young emperor eventually learns that friendship and kindness are the most valuable things in the world—more valuable, even, than riches.

Tie-in Activity: A heart is a symbol of friendship. Help your child draw a heart on a piece of construction paper. Next, ask your child to come up with words that describe what friends do, such as "sharing" and "playing." If your child is old enough, have them write the words on the heart. Next, take a scissors and cut the heart into puzzle pieces. Have your child assemble the puzzle.
